Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a player, where the player knows it's location on the board, it's name, number, and whether it has won or not.
    Version:
    6/6
    Author:
    Darren and Sushane

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a player object at the first space and has a player number based on a static variable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getHasWon()
      Accesses whether the player has won or not.
      int getLoc()
      Accesses the location of the player, corresponding to the value of each space on the board.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Accesses the name of the player.
      static int getNumPlayers()
      Accesses the number of players in a game.
      int getPlayerNum()
      Accesses the player number of the player.
      void move(int numPlaces)
      Moves the player in a forward direction on the board.
      void resetPlayers()
      Resets the number of players in the game, used in conjunction with the other reset methods.
      void setLoc(int val)
      Moves the player to a certain location on the board directly.

    • Method Detail

      • getHasWon

        public boolean getHasWon()
        Accesses whether the player has won or not.
        Returns:
        a boolean which is true if the player has won, false otherwise.

      • getLoc

        public int getLoc()
        Accesses the location of the player, corresponding to the value of each space on the board.
        Returns:
        An integer, which represents the value of the space on the board at which the player is located at.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Accesses the name of the player.
        Returns:
        A string, which represents the name of the player.

      • getNumPlayers

        public static int getNumPlayers()
        Accesses the number of players in a game.
        Returns:
        An integer which represents the number of players in the game, based on a static variable of the player class.

      • getPlayerNum

        public int getPlayerNum()
        Accesses the player number of the player.
        Returns:
        An integer which represents the player number.

      • move

        public void move(int numPlaces)
        Moves the player in a forward direction on the board.
        Parameters:
        An - integer, which represents the number of spaces to be moved by the player.

      • resetPlayers

        public void resetPlayers()
        Resets the number of players in the game, used in conjunction with the other reset methods.

      • setLoc

        public void setLoc(int val)
        Moves the player to a certain location on the board directly.
        Parameters:
        An - integer, which represents the value on the board the player is to be moved to.
